question: Which of the following statements concerning skin melanocytes is true?
exp: Melanocytes are present in the stratum basale of the epidermis. They synthesize melanin pigment and transfer it to keratinocytes to protect against damage caused by UV radiation. Melanocytes can give rise to a form of skin cancer called malignant melanoma. They derive from neural crest and migrate into the epidermis early during embryonic development.
opa: They synthesize a pigment that protects against damage caused by UV radiation.
opb: They are located only in the dermis.
opd: They may give rise to basal cell carcinoma

question: Which of the following statements about hair follicles is true?
exp: Hair follicles are present only in thin skin. They are associated with sebaceous glands and errector pili smooth muscle bundles.
opa: They are always associated with an eccrine sweat gland
opb: They are present in thin skin but not in thick skin
opc: Their associated Arrector pili muscle is composed of striated fibers
opd: Their hair shaft inses into the papillary layer of the epidermis

question: All of the following organs have no lymphatic capillaries EXCEPT :
exp: Lymph capillaries are present in most tissues of the body. Absent in: Avascular tissues (e.g. the cornea, epidermis, hair, nails, cailage) Bone and bone marrow Placenta Eyeball, inner ear Striated muscles and tendons. Thymus, spleen Teeth Central or peripheral nervous system Note: Unlike nodes, the palatine tonsils do not possess afferent lymphatics or lymph sinuses.

question: After their maturation in the thymus and release into the circulation, T lymphocytes migrate preferentially to which of the following sites?
exp: T lymphocytes are preferentially located in the paracoex of lymph nodes
opb: Coical lymphoid nodules of lymph nodes

question: Which of the following cell types is thought to function in suppressing the immune response?
exp: The immune response is decreased by inducible T reg cells. They suppress the formation of TH1 cells, thereby suppressing the immune response.

question: Which of the following statements about Langerhans cells is true?
exp: Langerhans cells in the epidermis function as antigen-presenting cells by trapping antigens that penetrate the Epidermis and transpoing them to regional lymph nodes, where they are presented to T lymphocytes.
opa: They are commonly found in the dermis.
opc: They function as receptors for cold.
opd: They play an immunological role in the skin.

question: All of the following are the components of the white pulp of spleen EXCEPT:
exp: - Spleen is composed of red pulp (~ 90%) having venous sinusoids and splenic cords (of Billroth). - White pulp (~ 10%) of spleen has lymphoid follicles with B lymphocytes at the germinal centers, whereas T cell lie in the periphery. - Antigen presenting cells (APCs) are present in the marginal zone of lymphoid follicles.
